title: Interfaces for Named Token
desc: Enable tokens to have a string name and be able to convert between name and id.

title: Token with transaction handling model
desc: Token with transaction handling model designed to behave identical to native currency (ether)

title: Token Converter
desc: Smart-contract service that converts token of one ERC version to another

title: Token with Metadata
desc: An ERC-20 extension for tokens with metadata.

title: Simple token, Simplified ERC-20
desc: Designed for smart contract wallets, this removes the transferFrom, approve, and allowance functions from ERC-20 tokens.

title: Fungible Key Bound Token
desc: An interface for Fungible Key Bound Tokens, also known as a FKBT.

title: Latent Fungible Token
desc: An interface for tokens that become fungible after a period of time.

title: Semi-Fungible Soulbound Token
desc: An interface for soulbound tokens, also known as badges or account-bound tokens, that can be both fungible and non-fungible.

title: ERC-721 and ERC-1155 to ERC-20 Wrapper
desc: A standard interface for contracts that create generic ERC-20 tokens which derive from a pool of unique ERC-721/ERC-1155 tokens.

title: Semi-Fungible Token
desc: Defines a specification where ERC-721 compatible tokens with the same SLOT and different IDs are fungible.

title: Re-Fungible Token Standard (RFT)
desc: ERC-20 extension for proportional ownership of an ERC-721 token.

title: Token Standard
desc: This EIP defines standard interfaces and behaviors for token contracts.

title: Dual Nature Multi Token Protocol
desc: Combining fungible token ERC-20 and multi-token ERC-1155

title: Dual Nature Token Pair
desc: A specification for a co-joined fungible and non-fungible token pair

title: Dual Layer Token
desc: Token with a two-level classification system using mainId and subId

title: Minimal Multi-Token Interface
desc: A minimal specification for managing multiple tokens by their id in a single contract.

title: Multi Token Standard
desc: A standard interface for contracts that manage multiple token types. A single deployed contract may include any combination of fungible tokens, non-fungible tokens or other configurations (e.g. semi-fungible tokens).

title: Basket Token
desc: Collateralized, tokenized funds with adjustable weights and reserves and minting/burning of LP tokens.

title: ERC-1155 Multi-Asset extension
desc: An interface compatible with ERC-1155 for Multi-Asset tokens with context-dependent asset type output control.

title: Context-Dependent Multi-Asset Tokens
desc: An interface for Multi-Asset tokens with context dependent asset type output controlled by owner's preference.

title: Soulbound Multi-owner Tokens
desc: An interface for non-transferable, Multi-owner NFTs binding to Ethereum accounts

title: Multi-Class Token Standard
desc: A standard interface for multi-class tokens (MCTs).

title: Multi-class Token Standard
desc: A standard interface for multi-class fungible tokens.

title: Singleton Factory
desc: A permissionless factory for deploy of keyless deterministic contracts addresses based on its bytecode.

title: Registry Extension for ERC-7579
desc: Adapters that allow modular smart accounts to verify the security of modules using a Module Registry

title: Multi-Namespace Onchain Registry
desc: An universally accepted multi-namespace registry with mapping structures on the Ethereum

title: ZK Identity Registry
desc: Singleton registry system for storing abstract private provable statements.

title: Reserved Ownership Accounts
desc: A registry for generating future-deployed smart contract accounts owned by users on external services

title: Diffusive Tokens
desc: A fungible token that mints new tokens on transfer, charges a per-token native fee, and enforces a capped supply.

title: Fractional Reserve Token
desc: An interface for tokens that maintain a peg to an underlying token while being only partially redeemable to this token.

title: Multiplicative Tokens
desc: Incorporates a multiplier field to ERC-20 and ERC-1155 for fractional token values

title: Tokenized Reserve
desc: Transparent reserve fund on-chain with stakeholder participation.

title: Supply Extension
desc: A simple mechanism to fetch token supply data from ERC-1155 tokens

title: Token Minting and Burning
desc: An extension for minting and burning EIP-20, EIP-721, and EIP-1155 tokens

title: Mineable Token Standard
desc: A specification for a standardized Mineable Token that uses a Proof of Work algorithm for distribution.

title: Abstract Token
desc: move tokens on- and off-chain as desired, enabling zero-cost minting while preserving on-chain composability

title: Minting and burning
desc: ERC-621 standardizes minting and burning functions for ERC-20 tokens, improving interoperability.

title: Expirable ERC-20
desc: An ERC-20 extension for creating fungible tokens with expiration, supporting time-limited use cases.

title: Zero-Knowledge Wormholes
desc: Enable minting of secretly burnt Ethers as a native privacy solution for Ethereum

title: Permit Extension for EIP-20 Signed Approvals
desc: EIP-20 approvals via EIP-712 secp256k1 signatures

title: Temporary Approval Extension for ERC-20
desc: Ephemeral ERC-20 approvals lasting a single transaction

title: ERC-1155 Permit Approvals
desc: Permit approvals for ERC-1155 tokens

title: ERC-20 Update Allowance By Spender
desc: Extension to enable revoking and decreasing allowance approval by spender for ERC-20

title: Auto-renewable allowance extension
desc: Extension to enable automatic renewals on allowance approvals

title: Endorsement - Permit for Any Functions
desc: A general protocol for approving function calls in the same transaction rely on ERC-5750.

title: ERC-1155 Allowance Extension
desc: Extension for ERC-1155 secure approvals

title: Permission Token
desc: A token that holds the permission of an address in an ecosystem

title: Signature Validation Extension for Permit
desc: An ERC to extend ERC-2612 Permit to support ERC-1271-based signature validation.

title: Deferred Token Transfer
desc: Allows users to schedule ERC-20 token transfers for withdrawal at a specified future time, enabling deferred payments.

title: Transfer Reference Extension
desc: Include a unique identifier (transfer or payment reference) for each ERC-20 transaction to associate transfers with orders/invoices.

title: ERC-20 with transaction validation step.
desc: A new validation step for transfer and approve calls, achieving a security step in case of stolen wallet.

title: Batched meta transactions
desc: Defines an extension function for ERC-20 (and other fungible token standards), which allows receiving and processing a batch of meta transactions.

title: Meta-Transactions Forwarder Contract
desc: Standardized contract interface for extensible meta-transaction forwarding.

title: Holdable Token
desc: An extension to the ERC-20 standard token that allows tokens to be put on hold.

title: Extending ERC20 with token locking capability
desc: An extension to the ERC20 standard with methods for time-locking of tokens within a contract.

title: Token Standard
desc: A extension of the standard interface ERC20 for tokens with methods that allows the execution of calls inside transfer and approvals.

title: Purpose-Bound ERC-20 with Conditional Unlock
desc: Extends ERC-20 with programmable restrictions, enabling transfers based on multiple unlock conditions as defined in EIP-7291.

title: Token Standard
desc: Token with transaction handling model

title: Owner-Authorized Token Transfer Protocol
desc: Enable third parties to transfer tokens authorized by a signed message.

title: Safer ERC-20
desc: Extending ERC-20 with ERC165 and adding safeTransfer (like ERC-721 and ERC-1155)

title: Transfer With Authorization
desc: Transfer fungible assets via a signed authorization.

title: Transfer With Authorization
desc: Transfer fungible assets via a signed authorization.

title: Secure Protocol for Native Meta Transactions.
desc: A contract interface for receiving meta transactions through a trusted forwarder

title: Token Validation
desc: A protocol for services providing token ownership and transfer validation.

title: Contract Ownership Standard
desc: A standard interface for ownership of contracts

title: Multi-step Contract Ownership
desc: Contract ownership management with multi-step ownership transfer mechanism for secure smart contract ownership

title: Proxy Ownership Register
desc: A proxy ownership register allowing trustless proof of ownership between Ethereum addresses, with delegated asset delivery

title: Light Contract Ownership
desc: An interface for identifying ownership of contracts

title: Contract Ownership Governance
desc: A standard for Governance contracts that holds the administrative ownership of other smart contracts with voting power distributed as ERC-20 tokens.

title: Access Control Registry
desc: Registration, unregistration, role assignment, and role revocation for contracts, ensuring secure and transparent role management.

title: Role-based Access Control
desc: An interface for role-based access control for smart contracts.

title: Use contract signature for signed transfer
desc: An ERC to extend ERC-3009 Transfer with Authorization to support ERC-1271 signature validation.

title: Semi-Fungible Token Roles
desc: Role Management for Semi-Fungible Tokens (SFTs). Enables accounts to share the utility of SFTs via expirable role assignments.

title: Reversible Transactions on Ethereum
desc: In this paper we propose reversible versions of ERC-20 and ERC-721, the most widely used token standards

title: Return deposits for distinct credentials
desc: Automatically withdraw deposits for existing validator records but with distinct execution withdrawal credentials

title: Social Recovery Interface
desc: Interfaces for social recovery account supporting various guardian types and customizable recovery policies.

title: Token Transfer by Social Recovery
desc: On-Chain Social Recovery taking users' reputation into account & using a nearest-neighbour approach.

title: Recoverable Token
desc: A standard interface for tokens that support chargebacks, theft prevention, and lost & found resolutions.

title: Standardized Ethereum Recovery Proposals
desc: Provide a standardized format for Ethereum Recovery Proposals (ERPs), which relate to recovery of certain classes of lost funds.

title: Transparent Financial Statements
desc: Open Transparent Financial Data such as Revenue, Costs of Goods Sold, Operating Expenses, EBITDA and Earnings Per Share for all Investors.

title: Onchain Representation for Audits
desc: Proposal to define a contract parseable representation of Audit reports.

title: Token State Fingerprint
desc: Unambiguous token state identifier

title: Human Readable Parameters for Contract Function Execution
desc: New Ethereum RPC method eth_sendTransactionToContractFunction that parallels eth_sendTransaction but allows for human-readable contract function execution data to be displayed to users.

title: Token Metadata Integrity
desc: This specification defines a mechanism by which clients may verify that a fetched token metadata document has been delivered without unexpected manipulation.

title: Scaled UI Amount Extension for ERC-20 Tokens
desc: Equity Token support for Stock Splits

title: Confidential Fungible Token
desc: Confidential fungible tokens use an account-based accounting model while maintaining the confidentiality of transfer amounts and balances.

title: Opaque Token
desc: A token specification designed to enhance privacy by concealing balance information.

title: Zero Knowledge Token Wrapper
desc: Enables any token to be wrapped, allowing secretly burnt tokens to be reminted — making privacy a native feature of every token.

title: Swiss Compliant Asset Token
desc: An interface for asset tokens, compliant with Swiss Law and compatible with [ERC-20](./eip-20.md).

title: DGCL Token
desc: An ERC-20 compatible token that conforms to Delaware State Senate, 149th General Assembly, Senate Bill No. 69: An act to Amend Title 8 of the Delaware Code Relating to the General Corporation Law, henceforth referred to as ‘The Act’.

title: Diamonds, Multi-Facet Proxy
desc: Create modular smart contract systems that can be extended after deployment.

title: Diamonds, Simplified
desc: A simplified diamond architecture for modular smart contract systems.

title: Diamond Storage
desc: Define storage locations for structs using human-readable, meaningful strings.

title: Domain Architecture for Diamonds
desc: An architectural pattern that organizes Diamond storage by domain using ERC-8042 identifiers.

title: Proxy Storage Slots
desc: A consistent location where proxies store the address of the logic contract they delegate to, as well as other proxy-specific information.

title: Universal Upgradeable Proxy Standard (UUPS)
desc: Standard upgradeable proxy contract.

title: Transparent Contract Standard
desc: This standard provides a contract architecture that makes upgradeable contracts flexible, unlimited in size, and transparent.

title: Upgradable Smart Contract
desc: A standard interface/guideline that makes a smart contract upgradable.

title: Minimal Proxy Contract
desc: To simply and cheaply clone contract functionality in an immutable way, this standard specifies a minimal bytecode implementation that delegates all calls to a known, fixed address.

title: DelegateProxy
desc: Proxy contracts are being increasingly used as both as an upgradeability mechanism and a way to save gas when deploying many instances of a particular contract. This standard proposes a set of interfaces for proxies to signal how they work and what their main implementation is.

title: Single-contract Multi-delegatecall
desc: This EIP standardizes an interface containing a single function, multicall, allowing EOAs to call multiple functions of a smart contract in a single transaction, and revert all calls if any call fails.

title: Minimal Upgradeable Proxies
desc: Minimal upgradeable proxies with immutable arguments and support for onchain implementation queries

title: Upgradable Fungible Token
desc: Upgradable fungible token, a simple extension to ERC-20

title: Generic Token Upgrade Standard
desc: Create a standard interface for upgrading ERC20 token contracts.

title: Trust Minimized Upgradeability Proxy
desc: proxy with a delay before specified upgrade goes live

title: MetaProxy Standard
desc: A minimal bytecode implementation for creating proxy contracts with immutable metadata attached to the bytecode

title: Versioned Proxy Contract Interface
desc: Multi-version proxy contracts that allow callers to select implementation

title: Crosschain Identifier Specification
desc: A self-verifying unique blockchain identifier that deals with forks.

title: Canonicalize the name of network ID 1 and chain ID 1
desc: The Ethereum network with network ID 1 and chain ID 1 is named Ethereum Mainnet.

title: dType Alias Extension - Decentralized Type System
desc: We are proposing Alias - a semantic standard for identifying on-chain resources by human-readable qualifiers, supporting any type of data.

title: Interoperable Addresses
desc: An extensible binary format to refer to an address specific to one chain.

title: Ethereum Network Configuration for DApps
desc: EVM-compatible network configuration specification for DApps supporting any custom network features through extensions.

title: Compressed Display Format for Addresses
desc: A display format for abbreviating consecutive identical hex characters in EVM addresses using run-length encoding for UI and logging.

title: Cross-Chain Token States Synchronization
desc: A paradigm to synchronize token states over multiple existing public chains

title: dType Storage Extension - Decentralized Type System for EVM
desc: This ERC is an extension of ERC-1900, proposing an optional storage extension for dType, a decentralized type system, specifying a general ABI for all storage contracts that contain type instances.

title: Cross Chain Write Deferral Protocol
desc: The cross chain write deferral protocol provides a mechanism to defer the storage & resolution of mutations to off-chain handlers

title: ERC-5219 Resolve Mode
desc: Adds an ERC-4804 resolveMode to support ERC-5219 requests

title: JavaScript `request` method RPC transport
desc: A standard for remote procedure calls between an Ethereum Provider and an Ethereum Client when both are able to interface with each other via a shared JavaScript object.

title: JavaScript Provider Event Emitter
desc: A standard mechanism for JavaScript Ethereum Providers to notify clients about chain state changes when both are able to interface with each other via a shared JavaScript object.

title: Crosschain Broadcaster
desc: Trustless storage-based message broadcasting for rollups.

title: Operation Router
desc: A protocol that enables smart contracts to redirect write operations to external systems.

title: Composable Security Middleware Hooks
desc: An interface for composable, runtime security checks in smart contracts.

title: Cross-chain Storage Router Protocol
desc: Provides a mechanism to replace L1 storage with L2 and databases through cross-chain routers

title: Universal Token Router
desc: A singleton router contract allows tokens to be spent in the transfer-and-call pattern instead of approve-then-call.

title: Rules Engine Standard
desc: An interface for using a smart contract as a rules engine. A single deployed contract can register a data domain, create sets of rules that perform actions on that domain, and then invoke a set as an atomic transaction.

title: Atomic Push-based Data Feed Among Contracts
desc: An Atomic Mechanism to Allow Publisher Contract Push Data to Subcriber Contracts

title: Contract Resource Requests
desc: Allows the requesting of resources from contracts

title: Standard Signature Validation Method for Contracts
desc: Standard way to verify a signature when the account is a smart contract

title: Private Key Encapsulation
desc: defines a specification for encapsulating private keys.

title: Signature replacement interface
desc: Non-interactive replacing of smart contract wallet signatures that became stale due to configuration changes.

title: Security Contact Interface
desc: An interface for security notice using asymmetric encryption

title: Proof-based Broadcast in ERC-7786 Gateways
desc: Cross-chain messaging using cryptographic proofs to verify messages between blockchains.

title: Cross-Chain Messaging Gateway
desc: An interface for contracts to send and receive cross-chain messages containing arbitrary data.

title: Secure Messaging Protocol
desc: End-to-end encryption for sending messages between users.

title: Cross-Chain Messaging Interface
desc: A common smart contract interface for interacting with messaging protocols.

title: Cross-Chain Execution
desc: Defines an interface that supports execution across EVM networks.

title: Token With Mint/Burn Access Across Chains
desc: Allow authorized contracts to mint and burn token representations during crosschain transfers

title: Dynamic Compliant Interop Security Token
desc: Security token framework with semi-fungible partitions for dynamic regulatory compliance management and cross-chain interoperability

title: Cross Chain Intents
desc: An interface for cross-chain trade execution systems.

title: Wallet Call Token Capabilities
desc: Wallet Call API extension for transaction prerequisites for common token types

title: Ratings
desc: An interface for assigning and managing numerical ratings

title: Simple Restricted Token Standard
desc: A simple and interoperable standard for issuing tokens with transfer restrictions. The following draws on input from top issuers, law firms, relevant US regulatory bodies, and exchanges.

title: Interest Rate Swaps
desc: Interest rate swaps derivative contracts

title: Financial Bonds
desc: Represents debt issued by entities to investors.

title: Smart Derivative Contract
desc: A deterministic protocol for frictionless trade processing of financial contracts

title: Vanilla Options for ERC-20 Tokens
desc: An interface for creating, managing, and executing simple time-limited call/put (vanilla) options.

title: Interface for wrapped yield-bearing tokens.
desc: This standard proposes an API for wrapped yield-bearing tokens within smart contracts. It is an extension on the ERC-20 token that provides basic functionality for transferring, depositing, withdrawing tokens, as well as reading balances.

title: Clearable Token
desc: An account which processes, executes or rejects a clearable transfer.

title: A compatible security token for issuing and trading SEC-compliant securities
desc: ERC-1450 is an ERC-20 compatible token that enables issuing tokens representing securities that are required to comply with one or more of the following Securities Act Regulations: Regulation Crowdfunding, Regulation D, and Regulation A.

title: Atomic Swap-based American Call Option Contract Standard
desc: A standard for token contracts providing Atomic Swap-based American Call Option functionalities.

title: Security Token Standard
desc: A proposed standard for security tokens - incorporating differentiated ownership, error signalling, document references, gate keeper (operator) access control and issuance / redemption semantics.

title: T-REX - Token for Regulated EXchanges
desc: An institutional grade security token contract that provides interfaces for the management and compliant transfer of security tokens.

title: uRWA - Universal Real World Asset Interface
desc: Interfaces for common base tokens defining compliance checks, transfer controls, and enforcement actions for Real World Assets (RWAs).

title: Chain-Specific Payment Requests
desc: A URI scheme for chain-specific payment requests.

title: Order Book DEX with Two Phase Withdrawal
desc: An order book-based DEX Interface that ensures the asset security of both users and the exchange

title: Token Exchange Standard
desc: A standard for token contracts, providing token exchange services thereby facilitating cross token payments.

title: Wrapped Deposits
desc: A singleton contract for managing asset deposits.

title: Deposit contract and address standard
desc: This ERC defines a simple contract interface for managing deposits. It also defines a new address format that encodes the extra data passed into the interface’s main deposit function.

title: Simple Staking Interface
desc: The following standard describes a common staking interface allowing for easy to use staking systems.

title: Principal Token
desc: Principal tokens (zero-coupon tokens) are redeemable for a single underlying EIP-20 token at a future timestamp.

title: Staking Reward Calculation
desc: ERC2917 is a new standardization for on-chain calculation of staking reward.

title: Exclusive Claimable Token
desc: This standard defines a token which can be claimed only by token issuer with payer’s signature.

title: Ethereum Verifiable Claims
desc: Reusable Verifiable Claims using EIP 712 Signed Typed Data.

title: Subscriptions and filters for completed transactions
desc: Provide a way for external callers to be notified of completed transactions, and access the return data of functions executed when a transaction is mined.

title: Subscription-Based Token
desc: ERC-20 extension providing access to a service or product that requires recurring payments.

title: Subscriptions on the blockchain
desc: Monthly subscriptions are a key monetization channel for legacy web, and arguably they are the most healthy monetization channel for businesses on the legacy web (especially when compared to ad/surveillance) based models. They are arguably more healthy than a token based economic system (depending upon the vesting model of the ICO) because

title: Charity token
desc: Extension of EIP-20 token that can be partially donated to a charity project

title: Consumable Interface (Tickets, etc)
desc: An interface extending ERC-721 and ERC-1155 for consumability, supporting use case such as an event ticket.

title: Fundable Token
desc: An extension to the ERC-20 standard token that allows Token wallet owners to request a wallet to be funded, by calling the smart contract and attaching a fund instruction string.

title: E-Money Standard Token
desc: The E-Money Standard Token aims to enable the issuance of regulated electronic money on blockchain networks, and its practical usage in real financial applications.

title: Payoutable Token
desc: An extension to the ERC-20 standard token that allows Token wallet owners to request payout from their wallet, by calling the smart contract and attaching a payout instruction string.

title: Money Streaming
desc: Money streaming represents the idea of continuous payments over a finite period of time. Block numbers are used as a proxy of time to continuously update balances.

title: Payable Token
desc: Defines a token interface for ERC-20 tokens that supports executing recipient code after transfer or transferFrom, or spender code after approve.

title: Purpose bound money
desc: An extension to ERC-1155 implementing a hybrid form of programmable payment and money.

title: Standard Bounties
desc: A standard contract and interface for issuing bounties on Ethereum, usable for any type of task, paying in any ERC20 token or in ETH.

title: Scalable Rewards
desc: A mintable token rewards interface that mints ‘n’ tokens per block which are distributed equally among the ‘m’ participants in the DAPP’s ecosystem.

title: Token Revenue Sharing
desc: Revenue token is a token that shares rewards for holders.

title: Refundable Fungible Token
desc: Allows refunds for EIP-20 tokens by escrow smart contract

title: Refundable Tokens
desc: This ERC adds refund functionality for initial token offerings to ERC-20, ERC-721, and ERC-1155.

title: Flash Loans
desc: Interfaces and processes for flash loans

title: Batch Flash Loans
desc: This ERC provides standard interfaces and processes for multiple-asset flash loans.

title: Flash Loans
desc: This ERC provides standard interfaces and processes for single-asset flash loans.
